nodes.label: Death penalty should be abolished
nodes.span: The death penalty should be abolished in all civilized nations.
nodes.paraphrase: Capital punishment ought to be eliminated across all developed societies due to fundamental ethical and practical concerns.

nodes.label: Irreversibility of execution
nodes.span: if the state executes an innocent person, there is no way to undo this grave error
nodes.paraphrase: Execution is permanent and cannot be reversed if the convicted person is later proven innocent.

nodes.label: Innocence rate on death row
nodes.span: Studies have shown that approximately 4% of death row inmates are likely innocent.
nodes.paraphrase: Research indicates that roughly 1 in 25 death row prisoners may be wrongfully convicted.

nodes.label: Deterrent effect claim
nodes.span: Proponents of capital punishment argue that it serves as a deterrent to violent crime.
nodes.paraphrase: Supporters claim that the threat of execution discourages people from committing serious crimes.

nodes.label: No deterrent evidence
nodes.span: comprehensive research across multiple states and countries has consistently failed to demonstrate any significant deterrent effect
nodes.paraphrase: Extensive studies have found no meaningful evidence that capital punishment reduces violent crime rates.

nodes.label: Lower murder rates without death penalty
nodes.span: States without the death penalty actually have lower murder rates on average.
nodes.paraphrase: Jurisdictions that have abolished capital punishment tend to experience fewer homicides per capita.

nodes.label: Racial disparities
nodes.span: Black defendants are significantly more likely to receive death sentences than white defendants for comparable crimes.
nodes.paraphrase: The application of the death penalty shows racial bias, with Black individuals facing higher execution rates.

nodes.label: Economic disparities
nodes.span: Those who cannot afford quality legal representation are disproportionately sentenced to death.
nodes.paraphrase: Defendants lacking financial resources for good lawyers are more likely to receive death sentences.

nodes.label: Closure for victims
nodes.span: Some argue that the death penalty provides closure to victims' families.
nodes.paraphrase: Proponents suggest that executing perpetrators helps surviving family members find emotional resolution.

nodes.label: Closure doesn't justify risks
nodes.span: this emotional argument has merit, it cannot justify a system that risks executing innocent people
nodes.paraphrase: While the desire for closure is understandable, it does not outweigh the moral cost of potentially killing innocent people.

nodes.label: Life imprisonment alternative
nodes.span: Alternative punishments like life imprisonment without parole can protect society while avoiding these moral hazards.
nodes.paraphrase: Permanent incarceration achieves the goal of public safety without the ethical problems of execution.
